text:
For those who are hiring managers, do companies think it is acceptable behavior to ghost midway through the interview process these days? The frequency at which I have been ghosted after multiple rounds of interviews is staggering, and, frankly, extremely disheartening. I even had it happen when it was down to me and one other candidate for a position (they told me it was down to two of us), and after putting the position on hold because of COVID, I discovered they hired the other applicant when they posted on LinkedIn about their “new employee.” 

It’s one thing to not communicate to applicants if they aren’t selected for an interview (though I feel like it’s not a lot to ask to send a generic rejection email, especially if you utilize an ATS), but it’s a poor reflection of the individual I’m communicating with and the company to not at least send a templated rejection email after an interview. Am I expecting too much?

For those who are job hunting, have you experienced much of the same? Or am I just especially unlucky?

elements.text:

text: It’s unacceptable, no matter how big or small the company is. Good riddance to them and although it may sting now, you should feel great you’re not working for an employer like that :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Yeah, I've been experiencing it a lot too lately...

elements.text: Yeah, I've been experiencing it a lot too lately...

text:
In the same boat as you. Companies have too much attitude and ego these days. 

Thing is the supply is greater than the demand and some companies just don't care to even send an automated rejection email and some don't even respond when THEY reached out and asked for your resume.

It's sad but that's how it is. Take a deep breathe and move on and just think it's their loss.

Having said that, I've also interviewed for companies who are just awesome at communicating the progress or they give you a login where you can track it.

text:
I don’t know about other companies, but we never ghost any applicants and we’ve never done that either. IMO it’s never been acceptable behaviour.

Having said that, I know a lot of companies have a lot on their plate right now (some verticals are really going through a rough patch where others are seeing lots of opportunity. it’s also holiday season, so there’s not much decision making happening) which could cause slow responses (or none at all)?

elements.text:

text: Maybe some companies’ attitude have changed because they think there is a larger talent pool now, that they can be more arrogant and demanding, play more hard to get etc.?

text: :wave: *Hi freelancers!* I’m working on an article for my company’s blog about maintaining a professional image as a freelancer. I would love to source some quotes or additional tips if anybody would like to be included (and credited) in the article. I will reply with the bullet points slated for the article already in case you would like to comment on any of the existing items.

elements.text: Hi freelancers!

I’m working on an article for my company’s blog about maintaining a professional image as a freelancer. I would love to source some quotes or additional tips if anybody would like to be included (and credited) in the article. I will reply with the bullet points slated for the article already in case you would like to comment on any of the existing items.

text:
Already included:
-investing in your personal site
-collecting and sharing testimonials on your site
-getting a virtual address
-modernizing your phone system (using something like openphone or google voice to separate your personal number)
-investing in a system for sending invoices

elements.text:

-investing in your personal site
-collecting and sharing testimonials on your site
-getting a virtual address
-modernizing your phone system (using something like openphone or google voice to separate your personal number)
-investing in a system for sending invoices

text: If you need anything, I'd love to help out. I've been working as a freelancer for a couple of years now (both full-time and part-time), and feel free to reach out if you need any information or have any questions for your article.

text: It's cold comfort, but I'd offer a piece of food for thought that the situation could be attributable to the maxim, "don't confuse incompetence with malice."

elements.text: It's cold comfort, but I'd offer a piece of food for thought that the situation could be attributable to the maxim, "don't confuse incompetence with malice."

text: I own a business, and our policy is to communicate with everyone at every step of the way, for any role, from transactional contracting to employment.   But I've also over and over lived the other side of putting up some kind of ad or announcement of hiring for a role and had my inbox absolutely buried in outreach.  I can recall a time where I stayed up until 4 AM replying to all of the good faith responses.

elements.text: I own a business, and our policy is to communicate with everyone at every step of the way, for any role, from transactional contracting to employment.   But I've also over and over lived the other side of putting up some kind of ad or announcement of hiring for a role and had my inbox absolutely buried in outreach.  I can recall a time where I stayed up until 4 AM replying to all of the good faith responses.

text: My point isn't to bang my own drum, but rather to point out how easily I could have missed responding to someone, tired, in the middle of the night, and just delivering "sorry, we already found someone" messages.

elements.text: My point isn't to bang my own drum, but rather to point out how easily I could have missed responding to someone, tired, in the middle of the night, and just delivering "sorry, we already found someone" messages.

text: And, if I had, it wouldn't have been my intention

elements.text: And, if I had, it wouldn't have been my intention

text: This explanation seems less likely when there are only two people remaining in the process, but the sheer disorganization of some people's inbox management has never ceased to amaze me

elements.text: This explanation seems less likely when there are only two people remaining in the process, but the sheer disorganization of some people's inbox management has never ceased to amaze me

text: Thank you all for your two cents! I’m glad to know I’m not the only one who considers ghosting to be unacceptable and I’m not the only one who has repeatedly experienced it. I feel for all of you who have also been victims of ghosting!

text:
Hey! You have several offers, but I've been a freelancer for a few years now and am also happy to help.

One thing other freelancers have told me (and it's 100% true), is do what you say you're going to, by the time you said you'd do it. It sounds painfully obvious, but this is something most folks struggle to do (myself included some weeks!) because it's difficult to prioritize, juggle, and focus...every single day.

But consistent, high-quality delivery will both distinguish you and earn referrals.

elements.text:
Hey! You have several offers, but I've been a freelancer for a few years now and am also happy to help.

One thing other freelancers have told me (and it's 100% true), is do what you say you're going to, by the time you said you'd do it. It sounds painfully obvious, but this is something most folks struggle to do (myself included some weeks!) because it's difficult to prioritize, juggle, and focus...every single day.

But consistent, high-quality delivery will both distinguish you and earn referrals.

text: I'd also recommend working hard for high-quality testimonials. I've had several potential clients reference mine, and they carry _much_ more weight than whatever I say about myself.

elements.text: I'd also recommend working hard for high-quality testimonials. I've had several potential clients reference mine, and they carry
much
more weight than whatever I say about myself.

text:
I have been that jerk, but not on purpose.

Recently I had some candidates that were way over qualified for the role but I wanted to make the case of maybe doing some contract work with them for some different work more tailored to their expertise.

Time went on, I couldn’t get a commitment from my manager because of legal and budget covid chaos, was completely overwhelmed with understaffing and mounting pressures to get stuff out because content leads were tanking, and then I blinked and two months had passed.

To reiterate <@U017XD7H4P7>’s point, it’s most likely incompetence, pressure and covid-related stress, not malice. We’re living in some stressful AF times and no one is immune.

elements.text:
